qas.question: What additional type of law applies in the case of migratory birds and endangered species?
What varies widely from state to state?

qas.question: What do state regulations govern regarding hunting vermin?

context: Hunting is primarily regulated <a5_0>by <a0_0><b9_0>state<b9_0/><a0_0/> law<a5_0/>; additional regulations are imposed through <a6_0>United States <a1_0><b10_0>environmental<b10_0/><a1_0/> law<a6_0/> in the case of migratory birds and endangered species. <a2_0>Regulations<a2_0/> vary widely from state to state and govern <b13_0>the areas, time periods, techniques and methods<b13_0/> by which specific game animals may be hunted. Some states make a distinction between <a3_0>protected species and unprotected species<a3_0/> (often vermin or varmints for which there are no hunting regulations). <a7_0>Hunters of protected species<a7_0/> require <a4_0><b11_0>a hunting license<b11_0/><a4_0/> in all states, for which completion of <b12_0>a <a8_0>hunting safety course<b12_0/><a8_0/> is sometimes a prerequisite.
